Authors: Sukmaningsih D.W., Wandoko W., Panggati I.E.
Title: Gamification effect between generation x and millennials: Study on e-commerce site
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmaningsih, D.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wandoko, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Panggati, I.E., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Gamification refers to technologies that aim to motivate users with incentives towards various behaviors, usually through the use of game elements. This research examines gamification in Shoppee, one of the biggest e-commerce sites in Indonesia. Based on survey data, this study examines the effect of gamification on different generations (generation X versus Millennials). The study uses a quantitative approach using SEM (Structure Equation Model) with Smart PLS to analyze the data. The result shows that there is a significantly different effect on both generations. Generation X show that perceived usefulness and recognition are an essential aspect of gamification. While for millennials, they show that playfulness and social influence are important factors. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Different effects; E-commerce sites; Game elements; Perceived usefulness; Quantitative approach; Social influence; Structure equation models; Survey data; Gamification

Authors: Wandoko W., Panggati I.E., Sukmaningsih D.W.
Title: Developing e-loyalty toward Online Retailer from e-WOM, Reputation, Information Quality and e-trust
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wandoko, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Panggati, I.E., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sukmaningsih, D.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Customer loyalty has been an important asset for an online retailer. Previous studies stated that e-trust is an important variable in building e-loyalty. Previous studies also show that e-loyalty and e-trust are influenced by reputation, information quality, and e-WOM. The purpose of this study is to empirically investigate the impacts of information quality, reputation, e-WOM on e-trust, and e-loyalty in Indonesian online retailer context. Data were collected to test the model from the millennial generation in the Indonesian as respondents, and empirical analyses were performed using SEM PLS. The results showed that e-trust is an important factor on e-loyalty, information quality has an impact on e-trust and e-loyalty, reputation also has impact on e-trust, and e-loyalty, information quality have a significant impact on e-trust and e-loyalty, and e-WOM only have a significant impact on e-loyalty. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-loyalty; E-trust; E-WOM; Information quality; Online retail; Reputation
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Sales; Customer loyalty; E trusts; E-loyalty; Empirical analysis; In-buildings; Information quality; Information analysis

Authors: Sukmaningsih D.W., Suparta W., Trisetyarso A., Abbas B.S., Kang C.H.
Title: Proposing smart disaster management in urban area
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmaningsih, D.W., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparta, W., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abbas, B.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kang, C.H., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Doctor of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study identifies technology and data related to disaster management with the concept of the Smart City. A natural disaster has a huge impact on city sustainability, it could destroy physical infrastructure, harm people, or make activities stop for a range of time. Environment evolvement in recent years, such as climate change and increasing population impacted to the natural disaster casualty. It then examines the technology to construct natural disaster management, consisting of preparation, mitigation, response and recovery for disaster recovery. Technology, such as IoT, GIS, big data, AUV, and Social media can be integrated to provide a solution for the city. Furthermore, this study proposed a model for smart disaster management that integrates ICT (Information and Communications Technology) and Smart City domain. © Springer Nature Switzerland AG 2020.
Author Keywords: Disaster management; Natural disasters; Smart city

Authors: Sukmaningsih D.W., Supangkat S.H., Kosala R., Ranti B.
Title: Toward Smart Mobility: Assessing Digital Service and IT Governance Consequences for Public Transportation
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference on ICT for Smart Society: Innovation and Transformation Toward Smart Region, ICISS 2019
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bandung Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmaningsih, D.W., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Supangkat, S.H., Bandung Institute of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Kosala, R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ranti, B., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Public transportation has become one of the important things in sustainable city development. This study discusses the factors that influence for increasing satisfaction of public transportation passengers, in this case, train passengers. In addition to factors that were discussed in previous studies, this paper also added digital service factors. This study conducted online survey and data analyzing using PLS-SEM method. Service delivery, onboard experience and accessibility are the most important factors in ensuring passenger satisfaction. Although digital service has not been a significant determinant in passenger satisfaction, this paper also proposes issues that need attention in relation to IT governance. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: IT Governance; Public transportation; Smart mobility
Index Keywords: Scanning electron microscopy; Digital services; IT governance; Online surveys; Passenger satisfaction; Public transportation; Service delivery; Sustainable cities; Urban growth

Title: Assessing High School Students Readiness for Mobile Learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmaningsih, D.W., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Learning activities has evolved into the next level. Using Mobile technology and its application, students can acquire knowledge and learn new skills. Mobile technology offers a different set of rules to learn and change how students can learn. Nevertheless, there also a challenge to utilize mobile learning. Some factor has implication for the effectiveness of learning using mobile learning. This paper will evaluate the readiness factor towards students' intention for using mobile learning. There are self-efficacy, computer playfulness, subjective Norm, perceived enjoyment and Content quality. The survey was conducted with respondents from high school students. PLS-SEM was used to analyze those factors. The result show that self-efficacy and perceived enjoyment are significant factor for readiness students to use mobile learning. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: E-learning; Information management; Surveys; Telecommunication equipment; Content qualities; High school students; Learning Activity; Mobile Learning; Mobile Technology; Perceived enjoyment; readiness; Readiness factors; Students
